info.title: Azure AgFoodPlatform Data Plane Service
info.description: APIs documentation for Azure AgPlatform DataPlane Service.

get.description:
Get a paginated list of application data resources for a given farmer and search criteria.

###### Note: 
1. Users will get paginated response with each page containing a link to the next page. Users are expected to iterate over all the pages using ‘nextLink’. The search comes to an end when ‘nextLink’ is null.

parameters.name: farmerId
parameters.description: Id of the associated farmer.

parameters.name: minAvgMaterial
parameters.description: Application data with average material greater than or equal to the value specified will be returned.

parameters.name: maxAvgMaterial
parameters.description: Application data with average material lesser than or equal to the value specified will be returned.

parameters.name: minTotalMaterial
parameters.description: Application data with total material greater than or equal to the value specified will be returned.

parameters.name: maxTotalMaterial
parameters.description: Application data with total material lesser than or equal to the value specified will be returned.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Application data obtained from the given list of sources will be returned.

parameters.name: associatedBoundaryIds
parameters.description: List of boundary Ids of the field/seasonal field on which the application operation was done.

parameters.name: operationBoundaryIds
parameters.description: List of the boundary Ids that were created using the geographical area on which the application operation was carried out.

parameters.name: minOperationStartDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that began at or after the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: maxOperationStartDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that began at or before the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: minOperationEndDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that ended at or after the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: maxOperationEndDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that ended at or before the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: minOperationModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that were modified (at source) at or after the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: maxOperationModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that were modified (at source) at or before the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: minArea
parameters.description: Application operations carried over area greater than or equal to the given value is returned.

parameters.name: maxArea
parameters.description: Application operations carried over area lesser than or equal to the given value is returned.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: List of Ids of application operations to be returned.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: List of names of application operations to be returned.

parameters.name: propertyFilters
parameters.description:
Filters on key-value pairs within 'Properties'.
eg. "{testKey} eq {testValue}".

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Application data with only given statuses are returned.

parameters.name: minCreatedDateTime
parameters.description: Resources created at or after the given UTC date-time are returned.

parameters.name: maxCreatedDateTime
parameters.description: Resources created at or before the given UTC date-time are returned.

parameters.name: minLastModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: Resources last modified at or after the given UTC date-time are returned.

parameters.name: maxLastModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: Resources last modified at or before the given UTC date-time are returned.

parameters.name: $maxPageSize
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: Skip token for getting next set of results.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The requested API version.

get.description:
Get a paginated list of application data resources across all the farmers for a given search criteria.

###### Note:
1. This API does a serial search of the database for the given search criteria. If the farmer Id is available, it is strongly recommended to use **‘List by Farmer Id’** API as it is performant.
2. Users will get paginated response with each page containing a link to the next page. Few pages may have **no items (zero results)**. Users are expected to iterate over all the pages using ‘nextLink’. The search comes to an end when ‘nextLink’ is null.

parameters.name: minAvgMaterial
parameters.description: Application data with average material greater than or equal to the value specified will be returned.

parameters.name: maxAvgMaterial
parameters.description: Application data with average material lesser than or equal to the value specified will be returned.

parameters.name: minTotalMaterial
parameters.description: Application data with total material greater than or equal to the value specified will be returned.

parameters.name: maxTotalMaterial
parameters.description: Application data with total material lesser than or equal to the value specified will be returned.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Application data obtained from the given list of sources will be returned.

parameters.name: associatedBoundaryIds
parameters.description: List of boundary Ids of the field/seasonal field on which the application operation was done.

parameters.name: operationBoundaryIds
parameters.description: List of the boundary Ids that were created using the geographical area on which the application operation was carried out.

parameters.name: minOperationStartDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that began at or after the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: maxOperationStartDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that began at or before the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: minOperationEndDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that ended at or after the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: maxOperationEndDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that ended at or before the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: minOperationModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that were modified (at source) at or after the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: maxOperationModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: Application operations that were modified (at source) at or before the given UTC date-time is returned.

parameters.name: minArea
parameters.description: Application operations carried over area greater than or equal to the given value is returned.

parameters.name: maxArea
parameters.description: Application operations carried over area lesser than or equal to the given value is returned.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: List of Ids of application operations to be returned.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: List of names of application operations to be returned.

parameters.name: propertyFilters
parameters.description:
Filters on key-value pairs within 'Properties'.
eg. "{testKey} eq {testValue}".

parameters.name: statuses

patch.description:
Create or update an application data resource for a given farmer.

###### Note:
1. The **‘contentType’** in the request header should be **'application/merge-patch+json'**.
2. 'Id' of a resource can only contain alphanumeric characters, '-', '_', '~' or '.', and must begin and end with an alphanumeric character. Minimum length of an ‘Id’ is 2 characters and maximum length is 50 characters.
3. 'Key' and 'value' in 'Properties' can have a maximum of 50 and 150 characters respectively.

parameters.name: farmerId
parameters.description: Id of the associated farmer.

parameters.name: applicationDataId
parameters.description: Id of the application data resource.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The requested API version.

parameters.name: applicationData
parameters.description: Application data resource payload to Create or update.

patch.description:
Create or update an attachment resource for a given farmer.

###### Note:
1. The **‘contentType’** in the request header should be **'application/merge-patch+json'**.
2. 'Id' of a resource can only contain alphanumeric characters, '-', '_', '~' or '.', and must begin and end with an alphanumeric character. Minimum length of an ‘Id’ is 2 characters and maximum length is 50 characters.

parameters.name: farmerId
parameters.description: Id of the associated farmer.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: Id of the attachment. This Id is unique for a given farmer.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The requested API version.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: File to be uploaded.

parameters.name: FarmerId
parameters.description: Id of the associated farmer.

parameters.name: ResourceId
parameters.description: This is the Id of the resource to which the attachment belongs. Ids of following entities are valid: Farmer, Farm, Field, Seasonal field, Boundary, Application data, Harvest data, Tillage data and Planting data.

parameters.name: ResourceType
parameters.description: Indicates the type of resource to which this attachment belongs. Valid values are Farmer, Farm, Field, SeasonalField, Boundary, ApplicationData, HarvestData, TillageDat and PlantingData.

parameters.name: OriginalFileName
parameters.description: Original file name of the attachment.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Unique Id of the attachment. This Id is unique for a given farmer.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: User provided status of the attachment.

parameters.name: CreatedDateTime
parameters.description: UTC Date-time at which the attachment was created (format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: ModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: UTC Date-time at which the attachment was last modified (format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Name of the attachment.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: Brief description of the attachment.

parameters.name: ETag
parameters.description: ETag value can be used to implement optimistic concurrency.

delete.description: Delete a specified attachment resource for a given farmer.

parameters.name: farmerId
parameters.description: Id of the associated farmer.

parameters.name: attachmentId
parameters.description: Id of the attachment.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The requested API version.

post.description:
Search for boundaries of a farmer intersecting with a given geometry.
This API is expected to be used when users want to find boundaries that intersect with a given geometry. Otherwise, this is functionally same as 'List by Farmer Id' API for boundaries.

###### Note: 
1. Users will get paginated response with each page containing a link to the next page. Users are expected to iterate over all the pages using ‘nextLink’. The search comes to an end when ‘nextLink’ is null.

parameters.description: Id of the associated farmer.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The requested API version.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query filters.

post.description:
Search for boundaries across all the farmers intersecting with a given geometry.
This API is expected to be used when users want to find boundaries that intersect with a given geometry. Otherwise, this is functionally same as 'List' API for boundaries.

2. Users will get paginated response with each page containing a link to the next page. Few pages may have **no items (zero results)**. Users are expected to iterate over all the pages using ‘nextLink’. The search comes to an end when ‘nextLink’ is null.

1. The **‘contentType’** in the request header should be **'application/json'**.
2. ‘Job id’ can only contain alphanumeric characters, '-', '_', '~' or '.', and must begin and end with an alphanumeric character. Minimum length of a ‘Job id’ is 2 characters and maximum length is 50 characters.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Id of the planting data cascade delete job.

parameters.name: farmerId
parameters.description: Id of the associated farmer.

parameters.name: plantingDataId
parameters.description: Id of the planting data resource.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The requested API version.

get.description:
Get a paginated list of scene resources for a given search criteria.

###### Note: 
1. Users will get paginated response with each page containing a link to the next page. Users are expected to iterate over all the pages using ‘nextLink’. The search comes to an end when ‘nextLink’ is null.
2. This API will retrieve scenes present in the FarmBeats datastore and does not ingest new data. Example: a user has ingested satellite data from 1st of Jan 2019 to 30th of June 2019. However, using the current API, the user has asked for data from 1st of Jan 2019 to 31st of December 2019. In such a case, only data for the first 6 months is returned to the user.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Name of the data provider for the scene. For satellite imagery, this refers to the name of the satellite data provider.

parameters.name: farmerId
parameters.description: Id of the associated farmer.

parameters.name: boundaryId
parameters.description: Id of the associated boundary.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source from where the scene was procured/generated. For satellite imagery, this refers to the name of the satellite constellation.

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: Scenes that were captured/made available (at source) at or after this UTC Date-time is returned (format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: endDateTime
parameters.description: Scenes that were captured/made available (at source) at or before this UTC Date-time is returned (format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: maxCloudCoveragePercentage
parameters.description: Scenes with cloud cover less than or equal to the given value are returned. Range [0 to 100.0].

parameters.name: maxDarkPixelCoveragePercentage
parameters.description: Scenes with dark pixel cover less than or equal to the given value are returned. Range [0 to 100.0].

parameters.name: imageNames
parameters.description:
List of names of images to be fetched.
For Sentinel-2, allowed values are: 'B01', 'B02', 'B03', 'B04', 'B05', 'B06', 'B07', 'B08', 'B8A', 'B09', 'B11', 'B12', 'AOT', 'SCL', 'SNW', 'CLD', 'NDVI', 'NDWI', 'EVI', 'LAI', 'LAIMask', 'CLP', 'CLM', 'dataMask', sunAzimuthAngles, sunZenithAngles, viewAzimuthMean and viewZenithMean.

parameters.name: imageResolutions
parameters.description: List of image resolutions in meters. For Sentinel-2, available values are: 10, 20, 60.

parameters.name: imageFormats
parameters.description: Format in which the scenes are to be returned. Available value: TIF.

parameters.name: $maxPageSize
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: Skip token for getting next set of results.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The requested API version.

get.description:
Get a paginated list of weather data resources for a given search criteria.

###### Note: 
1. Users will get paginated response with each page containing a link to the next page. Users are expected to iterate over all the pages using ‘nextLink’. The search comes to an end when ‘nextLink’ is null.
2. This API will retrieve weather data present in the FarmBeats datastore and does not ingest new data. Example: a user has ingested historical weather data from 1st of Jan 2019 to 30th of June 2019. However, using the current API, the user has asked for historical data from 1st of Jan 2019 to 31st of December 2019. In such a case, only data for the first 6 months is returned to the user.

coordinates.description:
Gets or sets coordinates of GeoJSON Object.
It must be an array of polygons, each polygon contains list of linear rings.
For Polygons with more than one of these rings, the first MUST be the exterior ring,
and any others MUST be interior rings.

PointCoordinates.description: Schema of the coordinates of a point.

coordinates.description:
Gets or sets the coordinate of this point.
It must be an array of 2 or 3 elements for a 2D or 3D system respectively.

Gets or sets type of the GeoJSON Object.
It must be an array of linear ring coordinate arrays.
For Polygons with more than one of these rings, the first MUST be the exterior ring,
and any others MUST be interior rings.
